title: What is the difference between the definition of a technology and a product? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology is the medium for the progression of concepts; whereas products are the concept's "signposts" along the way.  Let's say people would like to have instantaneous access to all the information contained in the universe. A PC was more at hand than a massive punch card computer  ... but laptops, tablets, smartphones brought you even closer to this concept. Of course it's not just about portability or closeness ... but the amount of data that can be stored, speed, etc...  For a more detailed explanation of this and other related thoughts, please read my Quora Blog post Yonatan Gordon's post in Community of Readers on Quora
Technology makes up technology products. A technology is just a method or idea whilst a product is a good or service which can be sold.
